title: A few nits left
body: ... and found during the IoTdir review.

title: Address all of the AD comments
AD review and last call comments
Register a CBOR tag for X.509 cert?
body:
We have registered tags for lots of common data structures. X.509 certs are a common data structure. This RFC would be a convenient place to do it.

It could be polymorphic based on the type of the tag content
- tstr implies PEM encoding
- bstr implies DER encoding
- array means hash of the cert
- URI means reference

This could allow the removal of x5t and x5u entirely. They would just be folded in with x5bag and x5chain. Any individual cert in the bag or the chain could be any of the types.

This is partly in conflict with my issue #22

title: recommend that the COSE kid be a Subject Key Identifier
body: Particularly with x5bag, the signature verifier needs to figure out which cert is the leaf to use to verify the COSE signature.  CMS and such did with the Subject Key ID and it seems that should be a described option here.

title: PEM, DER, BER or other format?
body: My first though would be that all certs should be DER format. No PEM or BER or such.

title: Require DER encoding for x5t
body: Since the data is being hashed, it has to be in a canonical form, so it should specify DER encoding.

title: Terminology -- header parameter?
body: Aren't x5chain, x5t and such header parameters?

title: Deal with WGLC Comments
body: Deal with WGLC comments from various people.

title: Move from the v2 to the v3 vocabulary
body:
Change versions of xml2rfc vocabulary
Address some comments from Sean.

title: Clarification needed
body:
About x5t:

> The first element is an algorithm identifier which is
>       an integer or a string containing the hash algorithm identifier.

Should this be taken from the COSE Algorithm registry? if not necessarily, what value can it take?

title: cert bag unordered
body:
the following text:

      *  If multiple certificates are conveyed, a CBOR array of bstrs is
         used.  Each certificate being in it's own slot.

about the "its own slot", confuses me. This seems to imply order. (I think this might be a copy-paste error).

Also minor "it's" -> "its" (here and in x5chain description)

title: ref uri format
body: It would be good to have a pointer to uri format definition (can be in terminology, but I'd prefer it after table 1 as that is where it appears first).

title: Update the -01 version of hash draft
Updates for latest version
body:
Separate hash draft from x509 draft
Updates to x509 draft
add more hash functions

title: Rename draft
body: Draft has been adopted by the WG.

title: Updates to document
body: Add text to deal w/ static-static DH

title: COSE_X509 CDDL
body:
The CDDL states

COSE_X509 = bstr / [ *certs: bstr ]

If I understand draft-ietf-cbor-cddl correctly, '*' means zero or more. Shouldn't it be

COSE_X509 = bstr / [ 2* certs: bstr ]

where 2* means two or more

title: Edits to fill out more sections
